headline: Creamy Smoked Salmon Pasta
description: This smoked salmon pasta features chopped smoked salmon in a creamy Romano cheese sauce with peas and mushrooms for a satisfying weeknight dinner.
name: Creamy Smoked Salmon Pasta
recipeIngredient: 1 cup frozen green peas, thawed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add penne and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes; drain.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion in butter until tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir flour and garlic powder into onion.
Gradually stir in milk. Heat to just below boiling point, then gradually stir in cheese until sauce is smooth. Stir in peas and mushrooms; cook over low heat until warmed through, about 4 minutes.
Toss in smoked salmon and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes. Serve over pasta.

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like this recipe since most of the reviews were positive but I have to say I agree with those that said it needed something - I'm in that camp unfortunately. As my husband said "It's just okay" and I have to sadly agree.
Yum. Though I did cut back on the butter, only using about 1/3 of the amount, and that was plenty. Will make again when I have more smoked salmon on hand.

This was really, really good! And super easy to make. I didn't have smoked salmon so I used regular and it was very tasty. I think the cream sauce could benefit from some additional spices, like pepper, red pepper flakes, and more garlic. But overall it was very tasty and an easy dish to clean out the fridge and freezer with. I found myself not measuring the salmon and veggies because a little extra can't hurt, right?

I made this dish exactly as the recipe dictates. The sauce was very creamy and delicious. I love that Allrecipes allows me to select the numbers of servings I want to make and presto, the quantities readjust. I was actually surprised at how delicious this turned out.
This recipe has become My favorite meals to make, Thank You!
I made it for some friends but subbed heavy cram for the skim milk and used fettuccine noodles. Amazing!!
Great flavor and an easy to make meal, I used fresh pasta so everything cooked in about 8 minutes. I think a bit less flower, the sauce was a bit dry for coating the pasta.
used angel hair pasta, and grated Parmesan in the sauce. ??
Used 2% milk, and a little more cheese. Added pepper for more seasoning. It was delicious!
Still very rich! Sautéed fresh mushrooms and garlic. Hated to dirty another pot so threw peas in with pasta. Used leftover smoked salmon from Costco. Served with crisp green salad.

Very tasty good! I'm glad I picked this recipe for the smoked salmon I had. I used 2% milk, and Parmesan cheese... the peas and mushrooms are a good addition to this dish. I think fresh mushrooms would be even better.

Quite simple, but really delicious. I actually used salmon fillets, and didn't include them in the sauce, but served the sauce to accompany the fillets. It worked really well, and I actually used cheddar cheese.
Added extra veggies-spinach and peppers. Good but needed some dill or red chili peppers
I made it with fresh, sauteed salmon, as I didn't have smoked salmon. I used cream, water and a shot of white wine instead of the milk. And I used fresh, sauteed mushrooms. It was delicious!

It was delicious by I did alter the original recipe.instead of skim milk I used heavy whipping cream; instead of penned pasta I used bow tie pasta; and instead of peas I used fresh baby spinach. I added two cloves of garlic, garnished with cracked pepper and scallions
I was disappointed with the sauce. There's no reason to thicken this with flour, as the result is a pasty sauce that distracts from the salmon.

Will definately be making again. I did modify a tad bit. I left out the mushrooms and about half the amount of onions since I have picky eaters at home. Guess what, they loved it. I'm sure the original recipe would also be delicious.
I didn't have frozen peas on hand so I used broccoli. It was quick, easy and delicious. I will make it again!
I made this today for a friend of mine who loves pasta and fish. They loved it, but next time I’m going to actually measure everything out and make a less thicker sauce.

I thought it was good. probably wont stick it in the "impress my wife repertoire". I will add less mushrooms, and maybe half again the sauce. I didn't do smoked, I baked the salmon at 350ish for 15 minutes then flaked it into the sauce. reheated well. I also used bow tie pasta, because, what's more classy than that?
I followed the instructions exactly. It seemed salty. I’d make it again substituting unsalted butter for the regular butter. It was a nice variation of carbonara.

A winner for exactly the reasons in the write up. I do not care for bacon but like the idea of a 'smoky pasta'. As others, I used fresh mushrooms and fresh garlic and maybe a bit more cheese but all other ingredients the same. For company, I might add a splash of white wine and would certainly serve a glass along side even just for myself!
A keeper to make again for sure.

This pasta dish is the ideal meal for me whenever I have some leftover cooked salmon. I use only half the butter called for and fresh mushrooms. Any leftover steamed or roasted veggies I have around get added to the dish too.

I used less butter, 3 Tbsp and 3 Tbsp flour and 3 cups of milk (I like to have enough bechamel to totally cover the pasta). Fresh garlic instead of powder. I leave the pasta a little bit undercooked and put everything together in a pyrex and bake it for 15 or 20 minutes until the top is golden.
Love this dish, easy to make and delicious
I have made this at least six times and always add white wine & water to thin the sauce to a proper consistency. The flavor is rich and reactions are always extremely favorable.
Loved it ! No changes
Delicious! Enjoyed the dish and shared with friends.

I love that this wasn't made with cream. I think if I was making it for company I would use cream instead but for a low fat version this is excellent. I used fresh cooked salmon not smoked because I had it and instead of peas I added spinach instead. I found it make 6 servings not 8, my servings were 2 cups. I will for sure make this again

I found this recipe to be bland. I did not have a problem with it being too thin. In fact, it was very thick and this was without the cheese. I did not add the cheese, but the recipe called for adding cheese at the end anyways. I tasted the sauce and found that other reviewers had gotten it right. There was something missing. I tried upping garlic, which I used fresh. I tried adding Italian seasoning, some rosemary, even cayenne to give it that oomph it was missing. I did add salt to up flavor and some pepper. Even with the addition of salmon into the sauce, there was still something missing (no, not the cheese!). One reviewer equated this recipe as turning out like a tuna casserole. I concur...it was very thick and seemed too heavy for a pasta "sauce"....it was edible but not worth the trouble of repeating.....

I made it and it tasted so good! Love it. I did change the recipe a bit, i used less butter and 1 tablespoon of flour. Also added in chopped tomatoes. sprinkle of pepper and chilli flakes to add a little more flavour to the creamy sauce.
Didn't like the sauce. not much taste. Wouldn't make again

I thought this was great. I substituted fresh minced garlic and mushrooms, whole milk, and added a bit more cheese but otherwise stayed true to the original recipe. Good flavor, and easy to make. I've also made it with bacon instead of salmon for the kids' preferences, also great.
I always use recipes as a base and modify to what I have but this combo is delicous

Delicious! I followed some of the tips and added fresh garlic to the simmering onions, then the mushrooms and the peas. I also used half and half cream that I had to use up instead of milk. I only had parmesan cheese, so I used that instead. I will use romano cheese next time. Yummy!!!

Excellent recipe. I made some substitution to make it more lactose friendly since I can't handle any dairy other than feta cheese! Anybody else looking to do the same - substituting soy milk, earth balance butter, and feta cheese work great and it tastes delicious. I've also used salmon patties from Costco and it turned out great with that too! With the patties I just added some Peppermon salt mix to the sauce. Super good!

Pretty good, but needs a little kick. Hubs thought just adding some salt was enough, but I'm not so sure. Will make again using a good Romano cheese instead of the can type. I think it would be fun to smoke your own salmon & then use in this dish. Don't know when or if we'll do it with winter coming up sooner than later though.
Delicious the way it is.
I added rosemary and basil it gives a perfect taste

This is an excellent recipe. I modify it by not using mushrooms, I add a tablespoon of mustard - French or English depending on what's in my pantry and I flake a thick portion of wood roasted salmon rather than use the thin slices. This recipe is a staple in our home. Yum! :)

It was really good ! The smoked salmon gave it a lovely flavor. I altered the recipe by adding shrimp and fresh green peppers, fresh onions and fresh mushroom. I also added black pepper to the sauce. For the cream we did light whipping cream instead of skim milk+flour. Nice flavors.
So easy to make & just great! My new favorite Smoked Salmon recipe- all the flavors balance out perfectly.
I followed the recipe exactly and agree with other comment, the sauce is way too floury tasting. Too bad, the pictures look so good.
We really loved this dish. It's easy to make, and the ingredients can be altered to accommodate taste preferences. It also freezes well without losing its flavor.

I had to make a lot of changes to this as good as it turned out. I swapped in fresh mushrooms instead of canned, I kept the peas frozen until cooking time to keep them from being mushy, I added a heavy pinch of salt, and I also needed to add about a half cup of the pasta cooking water to keep it from being too gluey. What I made was pretty good, but this recipe has some flaws.
very tasty and satisfying
Yum, yum, yum. Used fresh mushrooms, fresh broccoli and canned smoked sockeye salmon.
LOVED IT!
It was simple to make. I can't wait to try different variations.
Added capers and broccoli , all the family loved it!

I love pasta and salmon. So I wanted to make a pasta with salmon. I follow this recipe, which is very easy to follow. I didn't had few ingredients (I was missing mushroom and skim milk) in the house so I use what I had from the list. For milk I use soy milk, at first it was bit sweet but ad little bit salt and spices to adjust the taste and it turn out delicious. 
Over all I love this recipe, so going to save and use is in the future. 5 star! 
Tips: Taste much better once it's cool down.

I don't make creamy pasta dishes often, because they're usually so high in calories, and I love smoked salmon so I was eager to try this recipe. It was pretty good, but it didn't knock my socks off. I would rate it somewhere between 3-4 stars. Instead of onion, garlic powder, and canned mushrooms, I used shallots, minced garlic, and fresh mushrooms ... those changes should have been an improvement, but I still thought it needed some tweaking. For one thing, the sauce seemed too cheesy (rather than creamy), so if I make it again I might cut back on the cheese. Good concept, though!

Family liked this a lot...normally they aren't too crazy about smoked salmon. Unfortunately I did not know that until AFTER I brought 5 lbs of filets from Alaska. Only used one filet in this it was bigger probably 8 oz or so but it was plenty. Thanks for a good recipe to use up some of this fish-

Tweaked this recipe: fresh garlic, fresh peas and mushrooms. Used half skim milk and 4% cream. Used half cheddar and half Italian cheese as I did not have Romano cheese. Added a dash of white wine and used tortiglioni because I did not have penne. It won thumbs up from the family! Will make it again!
So yummy! I needed a recipe without heavy cream and found this. I also used less butter, lemon zest and some fresh dill. Did the trick! One more preggo craving satisfied :)

Wasn't crazy about this dish. I used fresh mushrooms but otherwise followed the recipe. Kind of bland. None of the individual flavors jumped out. Also didn't like the way it looked which was relevant for a dinner party.

This was good, it has a very light flavor. I used fresh mushrooms and spaghetti noodles instead because that's what I had on hand. A dash of salt and pepper when you serve it helps a lot. I might make this again.

My boyfriend and I loved this meal. I made my own adjustments. But the basic recipe was delicious. This was my first time making home made sauce and it was great. I used fresh mushrooms, orange bell peppers and spinach. Also frozen Wine cubes, fat free milk and all other called for ingredients.
Loved this recipe. I used both smoked and sauté salmon. It was Devine.

I have made this before and just looked it up to make again. I smoke my own salmon so use that and have some fresh mushrooms so will use that also. I like some of the suggestions so will use less butter this time and I don't like skim milk so will use 1 or 2%. I also will use minced garlic. This is a great recipe for a quick weeknight!
This was quick and easy but tasted like I worked hard on it. I will make this one again. I used fresh mushrooms and garlic. I will try the white wine next time.

This was exactly what I was looking for when a friend gave us some tasty smoked salmon! We really enjoyed the dish with 2 additions: I sauteed tomatoes with the onion and fresh garlic and added spinach at the same time I added the salmon. It will be a keeper!

So a friend gives us some smoked salmon every year that he catches and smokes himself. Pretty great, huh? But I wanted to do something different with it instead of "just eating it on crackers," as my boyfriend said. So saved by Allrecipes AGAIN. Loved this dish. Followed it as written. Still thinking about the flavors, AND SUPER FAST AND EASY for a busy weeknight.

I followed the recipe except I used parmesan instead of romano cheese and cream mixed with water instead of skim milk (didn't have milk). It's quite delicious and you don't need to add salt since the smoke salmon is kind of salty anyway.

For first time cookers like myself, this was very easy.!!! I tought it was gonna be really complicated but boy was i wrong. Love how it came out, tastes soo good.!! Next time instead of using peas (which i dont really like) Im gonna add Broccoli

OMG this recipe was so easy and delicious! I only used 4 tbs butter instead of 6, and I substituted chopped broccoli for the peas (I added it while the onion was cooking since it was raw). Husband LOVED it
loved it .used asparagus and cooking cream

I followed the recipe, however I used all fresh ingredients. I pan grilled salmon, I did not use smoked. I used fresh mushrooms and garlic. I sauteed the mushrooms in butter, added the minced garlic then I added a bit more butter with the flour. I added white wine, to deglaze the pan a bit, then the milk, however I added half FF milk, and heavy cream. I grated the cheese right into the pan, and made sure it was well salted. The Salmon was added last after the pasta was added to the pan and mixed in, making sure not to fall apart.

I have used this recipe for years now and I love it. Over time I have adapted it to suit my tastes...I always use fresh ingredients when I cook and substitute fresh onion, garlic, and mushrooms. I have found that sautéed vegetables make an excellent addition to this recipe. Tonight I used carrots, kale, red bell pepper, and mushrooms sautéed with olive oil then added when it asks to add the mushrooms. I also found out recently I can't tolerate gluten, and used brown rice pasta and gluten free baking flour as substitutions and it turned out awesome!

My husband and I really enjoyed the creamy sauce with the penne pasta. We marinated and smoked the salmon in a citrus brine and used 10 oz. of the moist smoked salmon pieces in this dish. I used parmassean cheese and broccoli instead of romano and peas. I also used fresh mushrooms and 2% milk but only 4 T butter. I will make it again.

Great recipe and so quick to do! My wife, who is not a fan of “slap it all together” food, actually asked me how hard it was to do since she would like to make it again. The changes I made are very simple: reduced butter to 4 tablespoons, all fresh veggies, and could not help myself to up the calorie count by adding two crumbled pieces of bacon at the last step with the salmon (yumm!!!).

Loved it! My husband brought home a piece of smoked salmon from Oregon. Not like the lox we are acclimated to here in the East. This recipe saved the day! Used shallot instead of onion, added fresh dill and left out the mushrooms (not one of my cupboard staples). I will use this recipe if that type of smoked salmon makes it to my kitchen again!
This dish was excellent, except the smoked salmon was just too salty. I think it could be 5 star dish with oven baked salmon.

Made this dish as a pre-marathon dinner for all the runners! With relatively light preparation (some chopping) this was a great meal for a group. Gave them good carbs to burn the next day and omega 3s. The Mushrooms and Peas kept it nice and light. I added Cayenne pepper to give it a little kick.

Simple recipe with wonderful flavor. I only changed garlic powder to minced garlic sauted with the onion. fresh grated Asiago cheese instead of romano. Used this with left over Alder Plank Smoked Salmon recipe also on this site. Will use both recipes again.

cream and noodles were delicious !!

but the smoked salmon was not....

personal opinion though of course (:
I'm new to cooking and this dish was easy to make and delicious. It tasted better then something you'd get at a restaurant
I substituted lightly steamed asparagus for the peas and it was delicious!

This recipe was good. I changed the serving to 4 and therefore my measurements were different that what is originally listed. Instead of garlic powder I crushed 2 cloves of garlic; instead of measuring the exact amount of milk, I just slowly added it to the onions and butter, and then a bit more when I added in the cheese. Instead of Romano cheese I used mozzarella (delicious). Instead of peas and mushrooms, I used broccoli (our family wanted to use broccoli instead). And I added lots of fresh ground pepper as I was cooking the sauce.
This meal was delicious and had great flavour! I highly recommend it.
This recipe is great with cold smoked salmon!

This dish was absolutely fabulous my husband and I loved it! However I am not a fan of peas so instead I used fresh mushrooms and zucchini. Also instead of Romano cheese I used Parmesan. Fantastic Recipe!

I made a few minor adjustments ... used fresh garlic instead of garlic powder, added salt/pepper and a little Italian seasoning. I don't like mushrooms, so I left those out. I only had enough sauce for about 10 oz of pasta ... perhaps it was just something I did. Very good - will be making this again.

It was only just 'okay'. The only change I made was using Parmesan instead of Romano.

I won't make it again
We enjoyed this. Used a spoonful of Philadelphia Cooking Cream
Really nice simple recipe but I recommend making the smoked salmon yourself! it is really easy and no special equipment is needed.

I threw this together for a quick dinner and was pleasantly surprised- in fact I enjoyed the smoked salmon much more when prepared this way. I didn't follow the recipe exactly- I used rotinipasta, which is what I had on hand, substituted spinach for mushrooms, and added about a tablespoon of lemon juice to thin out the sauce at the end. I would skip the onions and peas the next time as I did not care for their texture, and I would recommend using lemon juice if your sauce becomes too thick- I think it complemented the dish quite nicely.
I used canned salmon since smoked salmon is so expensive, omitted the peas, used fresh mushrooms, and parmesan cheese. I used olive oil to sub 3 tbsp of the butter. It had a nice, light flavor!

This was super yummy! I agree that it really tastes like a lighter version of pasta carbonara. Of course, I had to use a whole cup of romano and 2% milk was all I had. Otherwise, I followed the recipe exactly. It was easy and tasty. In the future, I might use a different noodle than penne pasta as it is not my favorite but that's a pretty minor detail.

I gave this a try to use up excess smoked salmon, and it turned out quite nice. I probably wouldn't put peas in it again (personal preference), and I used 1 garlic clove instead of the garlic powder (because I had one but not the other). I liked it a lot.

A pretty good recipe. Felt like it was missing something, but I dont know what it was. I made the sauce with less butter and added 1 cup of fat free half & half and used 1 cup of skim milk. I also used a mixture of parmesan, romano and asiago cheese and that added alot of flavor. I added corn and doubled the amount of mushrooms (because I love 'em). The biggest difference was that I used mushroom-stuffed ravioli instead of penne pasta, and I think that added alot of flavor to the dish. Not the best thing I have ever made, but it was pretty darn good. The smoked salmon added a nice smokey taste that I wasn't expecting.

Hate to say it, but this could have been better. Like another reviewer, I felt like the delicious smoked salmon taste was drowned by the sauce. Next time, I will use actual garlic cloves, and perhaps asparagus would be better than peas.
My Husband and I loved this. Very easy, light and creamy. A good way to use up left over smoked salmon from a bagel brunch the day before!
Use at least 1 c half and half and drier, not wetter salmon. Delicious!
I used fresh garlic, broccoli, parmesan and sun dried tomatoes - in other words, I kept the idea of smoked salmon with pasta and added in the fresh ingredients I had on hand. Turned out great.
This tasted okay, but probably not one I will make again. For all the more (less) taste it had, you could probably save a lot of time and substitute a jar of pre-made alfredo sauce instead.
Good way to use up some leftover salmon we smoked.
I might have portioned it wrong, but I felt like I needed more sauce.

I had some cream leftover, so instead of 2 cups of skim milk, I used 2/3 cups of cream and 1-1/3 cups of skim milk. I didn't have romano cheese, so I used parmesan petals. I used one whole onion, chopped up 2 cloves of garlic and decreased the amount or garlic powder. I also used 1-3/4 cups of peas and omitted the mushrooms. Overall it was good, but I think there's still some room for improvement.
Excellent! For the sauce I used about 4 tbsp butter, 1 1/2 cups whole milk, and a little under a cup of Parmesan.
